Job Posting:169202 - Position: F25 Software Developer Co-Op - Fall 2025 169202 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2025 - Fall App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 05/19/2025 09:00 AM Through Employer Website 05/05/2025 11:28 AM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Country Oracle Communications Inc. Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Salary Currency Salary Salary Range $ Job Description 2025 - Fall F25 Software Developer Co-Op - Fall 2025 169202 Co-op Position KITCHENER, ON Canada 4 months CAD Salary Not Available, 0 Major List $20,500 to $120,000 per annum. At Oracle NetSuite, we build the best-in-class system for automating business processes. We help our customers run their businesses and scale with them as they grow. As a premier part of Oracle's organization, Development teams at NetSuite enjoys a start-up culture with the added benefits of the strength and stability of a global organization. Our work environment is open and agile. We thrive on collaboration and global partnership to build a seamlessly integrated suite of features and flexible solutions. We have developers and product owners in eight offices worldwide, all rallying around one common purpose - helping our customers achieve their goals. NetSuite developers do more than write code. We become specialists in our business domain and take the time to deeply understand our customers' goals. We own the design of our product, bringing questions and ideas to the table and analyzing them. We develop greenfield code for new engines as well as maintain a powerful legacy codebase. So, you're interested in a co-op? We're looking for students who have great attention to detail, are currently enrolled in a Computer Science or Engineering degree with at least 1+ years of software development and object-oriented programming experience (academic or industry). If you enjoy critical thinking and problem solving and are a strong communicator, take this as a sign to apply! Co-Op students at NetSuite are a key part of the larger teams success and are treated like full-time employees. When you join our co-op program, you will be given a mentor to help you succeed and achieve your goals. We have a thriving co-op social program across our North American offices and create the space for you to network with and get to know our senior leaders. Looking for more information? Responsibilities Curious about what you'll do? Here's a sample of tasks and projects our co-op's work on: • Implement a database-driven web application, its features and tests. • Join the team's code review process in an active and timely fashion. • Take part in the resolution of production issues and work with team members, including Technical Support teams, to see the resolution through to completion. • Collaborate with fellow team members across all roles to deliver on a shared responsibility for quality. • Participate in writing automated tests to ensure comprehensive test coverage of features. • Assist in product roadmap discussions and implementation. • Follow the mentorship of full-time team members. • Participate in initiatives that make us stronger as a team (e.g. internal dash-boarding, metrics for our success in production, improved build processes). Contribute ideas and effort for continuous improvement for the team, in its Agile process and in its general team effectiveness. • Job Requirements Objective Minimum Qualifications: To be considered for a Software Developer Co-Op, the Objective Minimum Qualifications (OMQs) below must be met. Please ensure the application clearly indicates that you meet these OMQs. • Will be enrolled in a bachelor's degree program in Computer Science, Engineering Management, Information Systems Management, Business Analytics, or an equivalent field during the 2025-2026 school year. Graduating no later than June 2026. • Experience with Java and SQL • Understanding of HTML, CSS and DOM • • A passion for software quality Knowledge of QA processes and methodologies is a plus • Co-op/intern or other industry experience in software is a plus • Attend a university in Canada. Authorized to work in Canada in 2025. • Preferred Qualification: Minimum 3.0 GPA • Qualifications Range and benefit information provided in this posting are specific to the stated locations only CA: Hiring Range in CAD from: $20,500 to $120,000 per annum. Oracle maintains broad salary ranges for its roles in order to account for variations in knowledge, skills, experience, market conditions and locations, as well as reflect Oracle's differing products, industries and lines of business. Candidates are typically placed into the range based on the preceding factors as well as internal peer equity. Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Cover Letter Required? Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
